      • testUpdateEmailConfigurationWithOutException

        public void testUpdateEmailConfigurationWithOutException()
        Checks if the update runs without exceptions. And that the result is as expected (true).

      • testUpdateEmailConfigurationIsCorrect

        public void testUpdateEmailConfigurationIsCorrect()
        Checks weather or not the contents of the email configuration are correct. Therefore an new configuration is added to the databases. Afterwards the elements will be queried and checked.

      • testPostActivityStatusUpdateReadyToRunning

        public void testPostActivityStatusUpdateReadyToRunning()
        Checks if a activity status update can be performed without an exceptions. Changes the state from ready -> running. And that the result is as expected (true).

      • testPostActivityStatusUpdateRunningToTerminated

        public void testPostActivityStatusUpdateRunningToTerminated()
        Checks if a activity status update can be performed without an exceptions. Changes the state from running -> terminated. And that the result is as expected (true).

      • testPostActivityInvalidStatus

        public void testPostActivityInvalidStatus()
        When we try to toggle a non existing state transition it should not be possible, hence "false" should be returned.

      • testPostActivityIllegalStatusUpdate

        public void testPostActivityIllegalStatusUpdate()
        When the activity state ready but not active it should not be possible to terminate it. So we expect the result "false".

      • testInvalidActivityStatusUpdate

        public void testInvalidActivityStatusUpdate()
        If the state of a non existing activityInstance should be updated the response value should imply that it was not possible. So we expect the result "false".

      • testPostNewInstanceForScenario

        public void testPostNewInstanceForScenario()
        When a new instance of an scenario is started the newly created id is returned. We expect the ID 123.

      • testPostNewInstanceForInvalidScenario

        public void testPostNewInstanceForInvalidScenario()
        When the user tries to start a non existing scenario the return value should imply the fail. -1 Implies that the scenario does not exist.
